content.description: An athletic director believes that more than <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of the students in a certain school district exercise at least <math alttext="3.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours per week. To investigate the belief, the director selected a random sample of <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> students in the school district and found that <math alttext="60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of the students in the sample exercise at least <math alttext="3.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours per week. Let <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the proportion of all students in the school district who exercise at least <math alttext="3.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours per week.
content.question: Which of the following is the most appropriate alternative hypothesis to test the directorâ€™s claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="The alternative hypothesis is p equals 0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The alternative hypothesis is p is greater than 0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The alternative hypothesis is p is less than 0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The alternative hypothesis is p equals 0.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The alternative hypothesis is p is greater than 0.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="The alternative hypothesis is p is greater than 0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
